chapter.title: Z39.50
chapter.para: If Z39.50 search option is enabled, it's visible from the cataloging tab. To enable the Z39.50 search, the parameter Z3950.accessible must be set to 1. For more details on the PMB customization, see .
Caution : z39.50 search implies installing and enabling the PHP module YAZ on your web server. For more details, please read the PMB installation guide.

Z29.50 search allows you to import bibliographic data from a notice server like the one of the British Library. Provided that the British Library server is accessible from you computer connected to Internet, you will benefit of an automated book cataloging for every book that has been concerned by a legal deposit to the British Library.
You just need then to set one or more categories (thesaurus), eventually some keywords and your own notes, and finally create one or more items corresponding to your material situation.
The Z39.50 search allows you to greatly decrease the cataloging time. You will find it from the Cataloging tab, for more details, please read the PMB user's guide, chapter Cataloging.

sect1.title: Servers
sect1.para: Z39.50 > Servers gives you a list of all Z39.50 servers available in search mode. You can add here a new server or update an existing one.

For each server, you will need some parameters like the type of data returned, a userid and a password, etc. Contact directly the Z39.50 server administrator to get this profile. You can also search Google with the following search criteria "profile Z39.50" .
If you are a member of a RLS (regional library service) network, ask, if necessary, the RLS administrator his Z39.50 server profile.
PMB is provided with several server parameters corresponding to French-speaking needs and the American Library of Congress.
The customization of Z39.50 parameters is composed of various elements :

listitem.para: Server name : this is the name that will be displayed on the screen. You may define it.
Base : this information is part of the Z39.50 server profile.
Usage : CATALOG (cataloguing). PMB allows only Z39.50 usage for cataloging.
URL : server address. This information is part of the Z39.50 server profile.
Port number : this information is part of the Z39.50 server profile.
Format : Information this information is part of the Z39.50 server profile.
Userid and password : ID used to connect to the server. Those informations are part of the Z39.50 server profile.

sect1.para: Finally, the Z3905 server profile defines various attributes accessibles by clicking on the Attribute button. Those are the various search criterias of the Z39.50 server.
Each attribute is composed of a label and a numeric server attribute.
